### Check the distribution of the numeric variables in the data set (include different visual representations).

```{r, fig.width=20, fig.height=20}
# Simple visualization of the full data 
nums <- data %>% dplyr::select(where(is.numeric))
boxplot(scale(nums[,1:11]), use.cols = TRUE)

for (i in 1:length(nums[,-c(1:11)])) {
  print(ggplot(nums, 
       aes(x = nums[,i],
           fill = status)) +
  geom_density(alpha = 0.2) +
  xlab(names(nums[i])) +
  ylab("Density"))
}
```
